intro: Coleogyne, commonly known as the desert bell, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plants are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. They typically grow as shrubs or subshrubs, with hairy, drought-resistant foliage. Coleogyne species are adapted to survive in harsh environments, often blooming after rainfall.
